fields.response: You go to touch the clock and your hand passes through like it isn't there. It feels like your hand is in a vat of warm molasses. You find an object amidst the goo and wrap your hand around it. You pull your hand out of the dashboard. It's a human canine tooth.
It's locked
You unlocked the lockbox.

You go to touch the clock and your hand passes through like it isn't there. It feels like your hand is in a vat of warm molasses. You find an object amidst the goo and wrap your hand around it. You pull your hand out of the dashboard. It's a human canine tooth.
The man takes the diamond from you and swallows it. He looks at you with little expression. 'Hmm, not bad.'
The man takes the ruby from you and swallows it. He looks at you with little expression. 'Hmm, not bad.'
The man takes the emerald from you and swallows it. He looks at you with little expression. 'Hmm, not bad.'
The man takes the sapphire from you and swallows it. He looks at you with little expression. 'Hmm, not bad.'
The man takes the tooth from you and looks at it for a while. He turns his head and gives you a familiar, knowing smile. 'You remembered.'
The man takes the tooth from you and looks at it for a while. He turns his head and gives you a familiar, knowing smile. 'You remembered.'
The man takes the tooth from you and looks at it for a while. He turns his head and gives you a familiar, knowing smile. 'You remembered.'
The man takes the tooth from you and looks at it for a while. He turns his head and gives you a familiar, knowing smile. 'You remembered.'
You put the orange ticket in the box. You look over and something is different about the rope. The deep burgundy of the velvet has faded. You go to touch it and your hand moves right through it.
The rope is in your way

Whoever was writing this must have been in a manic state. The upper portion of the whiteboard is covered in characters that belong to a language that you've never seen before. Every character has an arrow coming from it pointing to a word at the bottom of the board. The words at the bottom of the board form a sentence that you can understand: 'ONE GOOD NIGHT. I JUST WANT ONE GOOD NIGHT. IS THAT SO MUCH TO ASK?'
Ring taken.
You try to take the watch from the skeleton but it won't budge. It's fused to the bone.

You grip the watch. You try to pull your hand away, but your hand won't budge. You look up at the skull and notice that it's lower left canine tooth is slowly growing. Once it gets to be an inch long, it falls onto the floor. You pick it up with your free hand. You regain control of your other hand.
It's locked
You press the photo against the ice and it melts into the side of the cliff. The chanting softens slightly. You hear a click come from the drawer.
You play some chords but they have no direction. You see that someone in the crowd froze mid-fall.
There is no microphone. Your voice sounds hollow.

The song echoes sweetly throughout the hall. Everyone is moving again for just a moment. You watch yourself fall on the dancefloor, and then everyone freezes again. You look back at the pianoâ€”there's a photo and a ruby on the music desk. You take both.
'Dedicated to Opal. It always comes in threes'
You put the ring on a finger of the outstretched hand. Something changes.
You put the necklace around the neck of the statue. Something changes.
You place the opal on the sundial. Something changes.
Won't budge. The key is impossibly heavy.
Muffin taken.
'Dedicated to Opal. It always comes in threes'
You put the ring on a finger of the outstretched hand. Something changes.
You put the necklace around the neck of the statue. Something changes.
You place the opal on the sundial. Something changes.
Won't budge. The key is impossibly heavy.
Muffin taken.
You reach out to touch the sundial and your hand passes through it. You feel a small object amidst warm, viscous material. You grab the object and pull our hand back. In your hand is a tooth.
You reach out to touch the sundial and your hand passes through it. You feel a small object amidst warm, viscous material. You grab the object and pull our hand back. In your hand is a tooth.
'I'm hungry.'
No. Gross...
The child grins and polishes off the muffin quickly. 'Thank you.'. They hand you a large opal.
You unlocked the lockbox. The key breaks
You pull the piano bench back and take a seat at the baby grand. The keys feel familiar under your fingertips. The smell of roses is potent.
The water is so cold that it takes your breath away as you climb in. The fish take you... the light is so bright its blinding...

You reach over and touch the pocket watch in the thin man's hand. Your hand phases through it and disappears. You feel something in the ether and you pull it outâ€”a tooth. He looks right at you: 'I knew you'd get it.'
